intro: Convolvulus intermedius, commonly known as the middle convolvulus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, which bloom in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
